699289-d-02-19-11-WC.Narrative: R90491-18 DELIVERED A CUT OF CARS TO NORPAUL YARD OPERATING LONG HOOD FORWARD. AFTER CUTTING AWAY FROM THE TRAIN, THEY RAN TO THE WEST END OF THE YARD AND WERE PREPARING TO DOUBLE THE CARS OFF TRACK 18 TO TRACK 1. THE CONDUCTOR REMOVED THE EOT OFF THE INBOUND TRAIN AND TOOK CAB TO THE EAST END OF THE YARD TO HANG IT ON THE OUTBOUND TRAIN. HEN THEN TOOK THE CAB BACK TO THE WEST END OF THE YARD TO GET INTO POSITION TO MAKE THE DOUBLE. AS HE WAS WALKING FROM THE CAB TO THE YARD LEAD, HE TOLD THE ENGINEER VIA RADIO "BACK 30 CARS", FORGETTING THEY WERE NOW OPERATING SHORT HOOD FORWARD. THE ENGINEERQUESTIONED THE DIRECTION OF TRAVEL BUT THE CONDUCTOR REPEATED THE ORIGINAL INSTRUCTIONS INCLUDING "RESTRICTING AT NORPAUL, BACK 30 CARS". AT THIS POINT, THE ENGINEER WHO HAD NOT SEEN RETURNED TO THEYARD OFFICE, BEGAN SHOVING BACK AND AFTER ABOUT 8 CAR LENGTHS ASKED THE CONDUCTOR IF HE COULD SEE THE REAR CAR. THE CONDUCTOR REPLIED "NO, I WANT YOU TO BACK UP TOWARDS NORPAUL". THE ENGINEER REALIZEDTHE CONDUCTOR THOUGHT THEY WERE STILL OPERATING LONG HOOD FORWARD AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT. HE THENASKED THE CONDUCTOR HOW MANY CARS WERE IN THE TRACK. THE CONDUCTOR REPLIED 26,26 OR 36 - HE DID NOTREMEMBER. THE ENGINEER THOUGHT THE TRACK WOULD HOLD 36 AND THOUGHT HE WAS STILL IN THE TRACK SO HEPULLED WEST. WHEN IN FACT, THE TRACK WAS SHOVED OUT THRU THE LEAD SWITCH THAT WAS NOT LINED FOR THEMOVEMENT. WHEN THEY CHANGED DIRECTIONS, NAHX 485339, SHPX 454464 AND PLCX 21294 DERAILED ON THE PREV

02202011VA-d-02-20-11-WW.Narrative: SWITCH CREW ON DUTY 2100 PERFORMED JOB BRIEFING.  PLANNED TO SET OFF HEAD 5 EMPTY HOPPERS ONTO RUNAROUND TRACK FROM TRAIN ON MAIN TRACK.  ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR MOVED THE 5 CAR CUT SOUTH OF SWITCH TOSIDE TRACK AND BEGAN 4 CAR LENGTH NORTHWARD MOVEMENT AFTER LINING SWITCH FOR SAME.  CONDUCTOR STOPPED SHORT OF SWITCH LEADING TO CORNING LEAD AND THREW IT FOR THE OLD RUNAROUND.  THE TRACK APPEARED CLEAR; THE CONDUCTOR MOUNTED THE LEADING EDGE OF THE 5 CAR CUT AND RADIOED THE ENGINEER TO PROCEED NORTH 10 CARS.  HOWEVER THE CUT OF CARS IN CORNING SIDING WERE NOT CLEAR RESULTING IN A SIDESWIPE COLLISION OF THE TWO CUTS, DERAILING 4 CARS; TWO FROM EACH CUT.  PROGRESSIVE DISCIPLINE HAS BEEN IMPLEMENTED.

TRAIN 3246 WAS A SINGLE UNIT CONSIST, PROCEEDING NORTHBOUND (RAILROAD DIRECTION), WITH FIFTY (50) PASSENGERS ON BOARD. THERE WERE NO (0) INJURIES REPORTED BY THE LRV OPERATOR, OR THE DRIVER OF THE AUTOMOBILE.NEW JERSEY TRANSIT POLICE WAS ON THE SCENE. THE REPORT NUMBER FOR THIS INCIDENT IS 1101537. THE LRV SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL COUPLER HEAD AND ANTICLIMBER COVER AS WELL. AS DAMAGE TO THE FIBERGLASS CAR BODY END CAP. ALL SYSTEMS FUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN WITH THE ACTIVATIONOF THE GRADE CROSSING WARNING SYSTEMS INCLUDING GATES, BELLS, AND FLASHERS. THE LRB BRAKING SYSTEMFUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN. A DOWNLOAD OF LRV DATA RECORDER SYSTEM SHOWS THAT THE TRAIN HORN ASSOUNDED IN EMERGENCY IN ADDITION TO BEING SOUNDED IN APPROACH OF THE CROSSING. THE PONTIAC GRAND PRIX WITH A MALE DRIVER HAD BEEN HEADING EASTBOUND ON NECK ROAD. ALTHOUGH THE RAIL CROSSING LIGHTS WEREFLASHING, THE BELL RINGING, AND THE GATES WERE IN THE FULLY DOWN POSITION, THE DRIVER OF THE AUTOMOBILE DROVE AROUND THE WEST SIDE GATE INTO THE CROSSING AREA WHILE THE TRAIN WAS APPROACHING THE CROSSING. THE AUTOMOBILE STOP IN THE CROSSING AREA WITH THE REAR SIDE IN THE PATH OF LRV 3508. THE LRV OPERATOR SOUNDED HORN AND APPLIED EMERGENCY BRAKE. WITH THE EMERGENCY BRAKING IN PROGRESS, THE LRV OP

A CROSS FUNCTIONAL TEAM OF INVESTIGATORS LOOKED AT ALL ASPECTS FOR CAUSATION.  THE TEAM EXAMINED ENGINEERING INSPECTION RECORDS, TRACK GEOMETRY, CAR DATA AND FIELD INSPECTION RECORDS.  MECHANICAL INSPECTIONS AND WHEEL PROFILES WERE DONE ON THE HEAD 5 CARS OF THE TRAIN AS WELL AS FIELD INSPECTIONS OF ALL COMPONENTS ON SITE.  EVENT RECORDER DATA WAS ANALYZED FOR ANY TRAIN HANDLINGISSUES.  THE TEAM CONCLUDED THAT NEITHER HUMAN FACTOR TRAIN HANDLING NOR MECHANICAL WAS CONTRIBUTORY TO THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.  THE TEAM WAS UNABLE TO RECOVER THE WEST FROG ON MAIN TRACK 1.  BASED ON THE FACTS, THE TEAM CONCLUDED THAT THERE WAS A CATASTROPHIC FAILURE OF THE TRACK AT THE FROGAREA.  RAIL = CWR

698274-d-02-09-11-IC.Narrative: C77671-08, A LOADED COAL TRAIN, STRUCK A HYRAIL TEST TRUCK AT MP 390.3 ON THE SHELBY SUBDIVISION ONMAIN 1 BETWEEN AULON AND PROSPECT. THIS COLLISION RESULTED IN DERAILMENT AND DAMAGE TO THE HYRAIL TEST TRUCK. NO INJURIES TO EITHER THE TRAIN CREW, THE ENGINEERING EMPLOYEE OR THE OPERATOR IN THE HYRAIL (HYRAIL OCCUPANTS HAD EXITED VEHICLE BEFORE IMPACT). THIS INCIDENT OCCURRED FIVE MILES NORTH OF HARRISON YARD IN ABS NON-CONTROLLED YARD LIMITS SPEED LIMIT 30 MPH. THE GENERAL YARDMASTER GAVE THE HYRAIL TEST TRUCK ROUTING INSTRUCTIONS TO OPERATE FROM PROSPECT TO LEE WOOD ON MAIN 1 NORTHWARD AT 0823 HOURS, THEN AT 0846 HOUR, GAVE C77671-08 ROUTING INSTRUCTIONS TO OPERATE FROM AULON TO PROSPECT ON MAIN 1 SOUTHWARD. C77671 08 ENTERED ABS YARD LIMITS ON CLEAR INDICATION AND WAS ESTIMATED TO BE OPERATING AT 18 MPH WHEN THE TRAIN STRUCK THE HYRAIL TEST TRUCK. THE GENERAL YARDMASTER FAILED TO ADVISE EITHER THE THE HYRAIL OR THE TRAIN CREW OF EACH OTHER'S LOCATION AFTER GIVING CONFLICTING INSTRUCTIONS.

000084895-d-02-03-11-CSX.Narrative: WITH 1 ENG CSXT 2793, 1 LOAD OF SAND, 1 EMPTY SAND CAR, THE B76003 WAS SHOVING WEST ON A 2.5 PERCENTGRADE APPROXIMATELY 1 MILE TO SERVICE FGI IN AMSTERDAM NY.  AFTER STOPPING TO LET THE CONDR OFF ATTHE PUBLIC ROAD CROSSING AND SWITCH BACK, THE ENGINE AND CARS WERE NOT ABLE TO MAINTAIN TRACTION ANDBEGAN TO TRAVEL IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION AGAINST THROTTLE POSITION #1.  THE ENGINEER APPLIED FULLSERVICE WHICH DID NOT STOP THE MOVEMENT; HE THEN PLACED HIS TRAIN IN EMERGENCY WHICH DID NOT STOP THE MOVEMENT; THE TRAIN CONTINUED TO PICK UP SPEED REACHING 41 MPH ON 10 MPH INDUSTRIAL TRACK.  THE OVERSPEED TRAIN TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 1 MILE BEFORE THE LOAD DERAILED AND ROLLED ON TO ITS SIDE AT A10 DEGREE CURVE, THIS CAUSED THE EMPTY TO BECOME DE-TRUCKED ON THE B END AND COME TO REST APPROXIMATELY 20 CARS AWAY STILL ATTACHED TO THE ENGINE WHICH IS NOT DERAILED.

000085738-d-02-20-11-CSX.Narrative: Y29120 WAS COMING OUT OF TRACK B21 WITH 65 CARS USING PULL BACK 9 FOR HEAD ROOM TO SHOVE INTO D01. THE SWITCHMAN WHO WAS ON THE HEAD END BEGAN HIS MOVEMENT INTO D01 AND SHOVED 30 CAR LENGTHS TOWARDS THE INTENDED TRACK WHEN HIS ENGINE STARTED TO JERK. THE SWITCHMAN STATED THAT THE ENGINE MOVED ABOUTONE CAR LENGTH BEFORE COMING TO AN ABRUPT STOP. THE SWITCHMAN AND FOREMAN BOTH NOTICED SOMETHING WASWRONG AND WAKED THEIR TRAIN AND DISCOVERED THE 23RD THRU THE 26TH CAR OF THEIR CUT WERE DERAILED. AFTER A COMPREHENSIVE INVESTIGATION WITH THE TAPS TEAM, IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE R&L 4 WHEEL OF THE 26TH CAR WAS FIRST TO DERAIL CAUSED BY A BROKEN RAIL.

697649-d-02-03-11-DMIR.Narrative: R92181-03 WAS TRAVELING NORTH AT APPROX. 19 MPH WITH 3 LOCOMOTIVES AND 51 EMPTY CARS WHEN 18 CARS DERAILED. TWO CARS CAME OFF THE RUN DOWN TRESTLE AND LANDED IN A WOODEN AREA. THERE WERE NO INJURIES,OR RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT FOUND THAT THE TRAIN WAS DESCENDING DOWN A 2.1% GRADE WITH 51 EMPTY SIDE DUMP CARS THAT HAD APPROX. 15,000 POUNDS OF CARRY BACK INTHE EAST SIDE OF EACH CAR WHEN DMIR 2192 REACHED LEVEL TRACK ON THE BRIDGE CAUSING THE WEST WHEEL ONTHE LEAD TRUCK TO UNLOAD THE DERAIL. 697777-d-02-04-11-DMIR.Narrative:
WHILE SWITCHING THE RIP TRACK ON THE SOUTH END OF PROCTOR YARD, R92581-04 WAS INVOLVED IN A CORNERING INCIDENT. THE CREW KICKED 4 EMPTY HOPPER CARS TO PE06 AND AFTER KICKING ONE LOADED CAR TOWARDS PF02, THE CARS ON PE06 ROLLED BACK AND STRUCK THE SINGLE CAR GOING TOWARDS PF02, THE BRAKEMAN ON THE ASSIGNMENT WAS RIDING THE FOUR CARS GOING TOWARDS PE0. 0211DV002-d-02-02-11-UP.Narrative: MDVGR-02 CREW WAS TRAVELING NORTH BOUND ON THE GREELEY SUBDIVISION AT MILEPOST 12.5.  CREW STATED THAT THEY HAD SLOWED THE TRAIN UNTIL THEY COULD CLEARLY SEE THE SIGNAL ASPECT AT CPW11.  ONCE THE SIGNAL WAS CLEAR, THE ENGINEER THROTTLED UP FROM DYNAMIC BRAKING AND THEY FELT A SURGE.  THE TRAIN WENTINTO EMERGENCY.  UPON INSPECTION, THEY FOUND THAT THE DRAWBAR AND CENTER SILL HAD BROKEN OFF THE NORTH END OF THE 5TH CAR (UTLX48648) A LOAD OF SUNFLOWER OIL.  NO EXCEPTIONS WERE TAKEN ON THE TAPE.  NO DERAILMENT.  THE CREW INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT DID NOT DAMAGE THE CAR.  UPON INVESTIGATION AN UNIDENTIFIED YARD SWITCHING CREW CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE CAR AT AN EARLY TIME.  RAIL = CWR
